description: Introduction to Bioengineering II. Continuation of the freshman introductory bioengineering course. This course introduces students to the design process and emphasizes its role in engineering.
name: INTRO TO BIOENG II

values.comments:
Although some felt that the course was interesting and served as a good introduction to “the design process involved in bioengineering,” others strongly opined that it was a waste of time, did not teach them “any aspects of design or bioengineering,” and should be removed as a requirement. A few even felt that the class discouraged them to continue as a Bioengineering major, especially after seeing the “substantive learning” in the introduction classes of their freshmen peers in other engineering majors.

Students did not directly comment on Dr. Rizk’s instruction. However, most students addressed the Nephrotex software program used in class. Some felt that it “helped [them] begin to think as an engineer,” but many “greatly disliked it,” and would have “preferred a more hands-on project” that accurately reflected real-world experiences.

This is a required course for bioengineering majors, and is intended for the spring of freshman year.
